Riddle: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears.
What has roots as nobody sees, is taller than trees?
I have keys but no locks. I have a space but no room.
Forward, I'm heavy; backward, I'm not. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind.
What has a heart that doesn't beat?
What can travel around the world while staying in one spot?
I'm light as a feather, yet the strongest man can't hold me for long.
I'm always in front of you but can't be seen.
What has hands but cannot clap?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air.
What gets wetter the more it dries?
What has a ring but no finger?
What has four wheels and flies?
What runs but never walks, has a bed but never sleeps?
What begins and has no end, and is the key to everything?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
I'm tall when I'm young and short when I'm old.
I fly without wings. I cry without eyes. What am I?
The more you take away from me, the bigger I get.
